channel.title: Political News - International and UK Politics | Sky News

item.title: PM might win this Rwanda battle, but has he already lost the war?
item.content:encoded: <div> Rishi Sunak is a prime minister who has always found it easy to build consensus on the world stage. <div>

item.title: Tories may well face disaster - but this mysterious election poll is designed to cause trouble
Sunak says Houthi strikes part of 'single, limited action' amid fears of escalation
item.content:encoded: Rishi Sunak updates MPs over the Red Sea shipping attacks in the House of Commons

item.title: British troops to be deployed to trial response to Russian invasion
item.content:encoded: Some 20,000 Army, Navy and RAF personnel will be deployed to the NATO military drill Pic: File

item.title: Sunak 'will not hesitate' to protect UK security after Yemen airstrikes
item.content:encoded: An RAF Typhoon aircraft takes off to join the U.S.-led coalition from RAF Akrotiri to conduct air strikes against military targets in Yemen

item.title: 'Critical' for NATO allies to grow defence budgets, defence secretary warns
item.content:encoded: Secretary of State for Defence Grant Shapps looks on as he gives a speech at Lancaster House

item.title: Scottish first minister's brother-in-law charged with supplying heroin
item.content:encoded: First Minister of Scotland Humza Yousaf at a cabinet meeting at John Muir House in Haddington during a visit to East Lothian as the Scottish Government's travelling cabinet programme continues. Picture date: Monday December 11, 2023.

item.title: Post Office campaigner will 'move heaven and earth' to get compensation sorted fast
item.content:encoded: Lead claimant Alan Bates (centre) speaking outside the High Court in London, after the first judgment was handed down in claims against the Post Office over its computer system. Picture date: 15 March 2019

item.title: Braverman joins pro-Israel protesters at London rally
item.content:encoded: Former home secretary Suella Braverman in the crowd during a pro-Israel rally in Trafalgar Square, London. Picture date: Sunday January 14, 2024.

item.title: Tory deputy chair says he will back rebels' changes to Rwanda bill
item.content:encoded: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Lee Anderson, MP for Ashfield react during a visit to Woodland View Primary School in Sutton-in-Ashfield, Nottinghamshire, Britain January 4, 2024. Jacob King/Pool via REUTERS
